info.title: OpenAPI Valyx API
info.description: To demonstrate features in the Valyx

parameters.name: billId
parameters.description: Bill ID associated with the billing report

parameters.name: contractNumber
parameters.description: Contract number associated with the billing report

parameters.name: billAmountStart
parameters.description: Min limit filter for the total bill amount

parameters.name: billAmountEnd
parameters.description: Max limit filter for the total bill amount

parameters.name: contractDurationValue
parameters.description: Value of the contract duration (if contract duration is 3 years, value will be 3)

parameters.name: contractDurationUnit
parameters.description: Unit of the contract duration (if contract duration is 3 years, unit will be YEAR)

parameters.name: billingFrequencyValue
parameters.description: Value of the billing frequency (if billing frequency is 2 months, value will be 2)

parameters.name: billingFrequencyUnit
parameters.description: Unit of the billing frequency (if billing frequency is 2 months, unit will be MONTH)

parameters.name: nextBillingDateStart
parameters.description: Start date of the next billing date filter

parameters.name: nextBillingDateEnd
parameters.description: End date of the next billing date filter

parameters.description: Auth key for fetching ledger entries

parameters.description: Auth key to authenticate the request

parameters.description: Starting date for Fee Component Update

parameters.name: updatedDateTo
parameters.description: Ending date for Fee Component Update

parameters.description: Auth key for fetching ledger entries

parameters.description: If passed will return all the ratecards available for a contract

parameters.name: showEmptyCombinations
parameters.description: If false will return only the combinations of tags that have at least one ratecard

ParseError.description: When a mask can't be parsed

MaskError.description: When any error occurs on mask

ValyxSignature.name: X-Valyx-Signature
ValyxSignature.description: Auth key for fetching ledger entries

name.description: A unique name identifying the usage driver.

description.description: Detailed explanation of what this usage driver measures or tracks.

unit.description: The unit of measurement for this usage driver (e.g., count, GB, minutes).

productId.description: Optional: ID of the product this usage driver is associated with, if any.

error.description: Error message, if any. Null if the request was successful.

message.description: Human-readable message describing the result of the operation.

id.description: Unique identifier of the added/created object.

error.description: Error message, if any occurred while fetching the paginated data. Null if the request was successful.

totalDocs.description: Total number of documents/items available across all pages.

docs.description: Array of items on the current page.

items.description: Individual document/item in the paginated result.

hasNext.description: True if there is a next page available.

hasPrev.description: True if there is a previous page available.

prevPageNumber.description: Page number of the previous page. Null if current page is the first page.

nextPageNumber.description: Page number of the next page. Null if current page is the last page.

name.description: The unique name of the fee component.

taxRate.description: List of taxes applicable to this fee component. Each tax includes its name, value, and category.

hsnOrSacCode.description: HSN (Harmonized System of Nomenclature) code or SAC (Service Accounting Code) for GST classification.

sku.description: Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) – a unique identifier for the product or service. Useful for inventory or internal tracking.

unit.description: The unit of measurement for this fee component (e.g., 'GB', 'Hour', 'User'). Used when calculating usage-based charges.

description.description: Optional detailed description of the fee component.

billLimit.description: Optional limits for billing this component, e.g., min/max values or usage-based tiers.

driverUpsertRequest.description: Optional usage driver relationships, defining how different usage drivers contribute to this fee component's calculations.

name.description: The name of the tax, e.g., 'GST', 'CESS', or 'Service Tax'.

value.description: The percentage value of the tax (e.g., 18 for 18%).

isActive.description: Whether this tax is currently active. Defaults to true.

taxCategory.description: The category of the tax. Helps classify taxes for reporting and compliance.

upsertRequests.description: List of usage driver relationships. Each entry defines a usage driver and its weight in calculating the fee.

usageDriverId.description: The unique identifier of the usage driver, e.g., 'API_CALLS', 'STORAGE_GB'.

weight.description: The factor by which the usage driver contributes to this fee component. For example, 1.5 means 150% of the usage is charged.

error.description: Error message if the operation failed. Null if the operation was successful.

message.description: Informational message about the result of the operation.

id.description: Unique identifier of the created fee component.

name.description: The name of the rate card.

description.description: Pricing strategy details for the rate card, including billing scheme, tiers, and prorated settings.

feeComponentId.description: Identifier of the fee component associated with this rate card.

currency.description: Currency used for this rate card. Must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code. See: https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html

currencyId.description: Optional currency identifier if multiple currencies are supported.

tags.description: Custom key-value tags for categorizing or labeling the rate card. Multiple key-value pairs can be added dynamically.

ratecardDescription.description: Detailed description of the rate card, visible to users. See: https://docs.valyx.com/api-reference/endpoint/ratecard#rate-card-description

contractId.description: Optional associated contract ID for this rate card.

isDefault.description: Indicates whether this rate card is the default for the company.

isTierSplitEnabled.description: Indicates if tier-wise split pricing is enabled. Only valid for graduated billing schemes.

startDate.description: Optional start date of the rate card.

endDate.description: Optional end date of the rate card.

fallBackRatecardId.description: Required if the rate card has start or end dates; used as fallback for timed rate cards.

CreateRateCardRequestModeldescription.description: Defines the pricing strategy for this rate card, including billing scheme, tiers, and prorated behavior.

billingScheme.description: The billing method applied to this rate card.

tiers.description: Optional tiered pricing structure. Only required for certain billing schemes like GRADUATED.

isProrated.description: Indicates whether the pricing is prorated for partial periods.

CreateRateCardRequestModeldescriptiontie.description: Represents a single tier in a tiered pricing strategy.

name.description: Name or label for this tier, e.g., 'Basic', 'Premium'.

upTo.description: The maximum quantity or usage for this tier.

unitPrice.description: Price per unit within this tier.

flatPrice.description: Fixed price added for this tier, regardless of units used.

isPercentage.description: Indicates whether the prices are in percentage rather than absolute amounts.

repeatTier.description: If true, this tier is repeated indefinitely beyond 'upTo'.

error.description: Error message if the operation failed. Null if the operation was successful.

message.description: Informational message about the result of the operation.

data.description: Data object containing the result of the operation.

id.description: Unique identifier of the created or updated rate card.

customerId.description: The unique identifier of the customer associated with this contract

contractNumber.description: A unique reference number for this contract

contractTitle.description: The title or name of the contract

contractPeriod.description: The total duration of the contract, specifying the time unit and value

billingFrequency.description: How often billing should occur for this contract

startDate.description: The date when the contract becomes effective

virtualStartDate.description: A calculated start date for billing purposes, used if billing time is set to beginning of period

creditTermId.description: Identifier for the credit term associated with this contract

noteInvoice.description: Optional note to be included in the invoice

terms.description: Terms and conditions associated with this contract

noteContract.description: Optional note to be displayed on the contract
noteContract.example: This contract is for the premium subscription plan

billingDiscounts.description: List of discounts applicable during billing

isPreusage.description: Indicates if billing should happen at the start of the period (pre-usage)

billingTime.description: Determines when billing is calculated: either at the beginning of the period or based on subscription start date

billingReportLimit.description: Limits applied to the billing report for this contract

contractLimit.description: Optional limit on total contract value or usage

advanceConfig.description: Configuration for advance billing or usage adjustments

autoRenew.description: If true, the contract will automatically renew at the end of its period

renewalPeriod.description: The duration for which the contract should be renewed automatically

unit.description: The unit of time for the contract period

value.description: The duration of the contract in the specified unit

unit.description: The unit of time used for billing frequency

value.description: The number of units between each billing cycle

amount.description: Fixed discount amount to be applied (in the contract currency). Either amount or percentage should be set.

percentage.description: Discount percentage to be applied. Either amount or percentage should be set.

isPostTax.description: If true, discount is applied after tax calculation; otherwise, before tax.

isUsageBased.description: Indicates whether this discount is applicable only to usage-based charges.

tiers.description: Optional tiered discount levels based on usage.

priority.description: Determines the order in which discounts are applied; lower numbers are applied first.

isStackable.description: If true, this discount can be combined with other discounts; otherwise, it is exclusive.

duration.description: Optional duration specifying the billing periods when this discount is active.

amount.description: Fixed discount amount for this tier. Either amount or percentage should be set.

percentage.description: Discount percentage for this tier. Either amount or percentage should be set.

isPostTax.description: Indicates if this tiered discount is applied after tax calculation. If false, it is applied before tax.

upTo.description: Maximum usage or amount this tier applies to. Use a very large number for no limit.

startIndex.description: The starting billing period index when this discount becomes applicable. Indexing starts at 1.

endIndex.description: The ending billing period index up to which this discount is applicable.

tiers.description: Optional list of tiered limits that apply based on usage thresholds.

isUsageBased.description: Indicates if the report limit is based on usage. If true, the tiers and min/max values are interpreted per usage unit.

minValue.description: Minimum allowed value for the billing report. Can be omitted if no minimum is required.

maxValue.description: Maximum allowed value for the billing report. Can be omitted if no maximum is required.

minValue.description: The minimum value for this tier. Billing will start counting from this value. Optional if no lower bound is needed.

maxValue.description: The maximum value for this tier. Optional if no upper bound is required.

upTo.description: The upper limit of this tier. Usage or billing beyond this value will fall into the next tier. Can be set to a very large number to indicate no limit.

tiers.description: A list of tiers defining usage limits for this contract. Each tier can have a min and max value. Optional if the contract has no tiered limits.

isUsageBased.description: Indicates whether the contract limit is usage-based. If true, the system will enforce usage thresholds; otherwise, limits apply to other metrics.

minValue.description: The minimum contract limit value. Billing or usage will start counting from this threshold.

maxValue.description: The maximum contract limit value. Usage beyond this value will be restricted or handled as per contract rules.

minValue.description: The minimum value for this contract tier. Usage or billing calculations start from this threshold.

maxValue.description: The maximum value for this contract tier. Usage beyond this value will be restricted or handled according to contract rules.

upTo.description: Defines the upper bound for this tier. All usage up to this value will fall under this tier. Use Infinity for no upper limit.

trueUpEnabled.description: Indicates whether true-up adjustments are enabled. True-up allows increasing charges based on actual usage at the end of a billing period.

trueDownEnabled.description: Indicates whether true-down adjustments are enabled. True-down allows reducing charges based on lower actual usage at the end of a billing period.

actualUsageOverride.description: If true, allows manually overriding the actual usage for this contract.

fileName.description: The name of the file uploaded for advance usage configuration, if any.

attachmentId.description: The ID of the uploaded file stored in the system for reference or download.

unit.description: The time unit for the renewal period. Specifies whether the contract should auto-renew after a number of days, weeks, months, or years.

value.description: The number of units after which the contract will auto-renew. For example, value=3 and unit=MONTH means the contract renews every 3 months.

error.description: Error message, if any. Null if the request was successful.

message.description: Human-readable message describing the result of the operation.

id.description: Unique identifier of the added/created object.

feeComponentId.description: The unique identifier of the fee component to associate with the contract.

contractId.description: The unique identifier of the contract to which the fee component will be linked.

buyerId.description: Unique identifier of the buyer associated with this usage event

contractId.description: Identifier of the contract under which the usage is recorded

eventId.description: Optional unique ID for this usage event, useful for idempotency

eventTimeStamp.description: Unix timestamp in milliseconds representing when the usage occurred

tags.description: Custom key-value tags associated with this usage

metrics.description: List of usage metrics for this event

usage_driver_id.description: Identifier for the usage driver or metric type

quantity.description: The measured quantity for this usage driver

count.description: Optional count associated with this metric

usageReferenceId.description: A unique reference ID for tracking this usage event across systems

metadata.description: Optional metadata for storing extra key-value information about the usage event.

UsageResponseModel.description: Response returned after adding a usage event. Contains status and optional data.

error.description: Error message if the operation failed; null if successful

message.description: Human-readable message indicating the result of the operation

UsageResponseData.description: Details of the usage event that was just created. Can be empty if no extra data is returned.

id.description: Unique identifier of the usage event
